title: Tornado and Importance Plots
text: tornado plot visualization range outputs expected variety inputs, alternatively, sensitivity output range inputs. Tornado plots number features: center tornado plotted response expected mean input variable. range variable. input set maximum, minimum, mean. multiplicative factor variable mean. input set 100(1−α)100(1 - \alpha)% 100(1+α)100(1+\alpha)% mean. quantile variable’s distribution input data. input set 100(1−α)100(1 - \alpha) percentile 100(1+α)100(1+\alpha) percentile Variables ordered vertically widest bar top narrowest bottom. one variable moved mean value time. Factors categorical variables also added plots plotting dots resulting output factor varied levels. base factor level chosen input variable center tornado factors present. importance plot attempts display relative impact variable model fit. Traditionally, linear models, concept importance expressed percentage total response variable variance explained variable, either alone, presence variables model. model type can different measures importance. package, following methods used: Linear Models: percent total variance explained variable alone cumulatively variables model. Generalized Linear Models: linear models, using deviance instead variance. Survival Models, LASSO, Ridge Regression: decrease model Mean Squared Error variable permuted data set. Permuting variable data set remove explanatory power variable relative variables model still correlated response variable. caret package models: definition variable importance model caret package taken varImp method. See caret package specifics.

title: Tornado and Importance Plots
text: standard data sets used examples: mtcars: Motor Trend Car Road Tests - predict Miles Per Gallon (mpg) based car factors mtcars_w_factors: mtcars dataset numeric variables replaced categorical factor variables appropriate. e.g. Automatic vs Manual transmission survival::ovarian: Ovarian Cancer Survival Data - predict survival time survival::bladder: Bladder Cancer recurrences - risk bladder cancer recurrence iris: Edgar Anderson’s Iris Data - predict type iris measurements
code: mtcars_w_factors <- mtcars # Automatic vs Manual mtcars_w_factors$am <- factor(mtcars$am) # V or Straight cylinder arrangement mtcars_w_factors$vs <- factor(mtcars$vs) # number of cylinders mtcars_w_factors$cyl <- factor(mtcars$cyl) # number of forward gears mtcars_w_factors$gear <- factor(mtcars$gear) # number of carburetors mtcars_w_factors$carb <- factor(mtcars$carb)

title: Tornado and Importance Plots
code: lm1 <- lm(mpg ~ cyl*wt*hp, data = mtcars) torn1 <- tornado::tornado(lm1, type = "PercentChange", alpha = 0.10) plot(torn1, xlabel = "MPG", geom_bar_control = list(width = 0.4))

title: Tornado and Importance Plots
code: torn2 <- tornado::tornado(lm1, type = "ranges") plot(torn2, xlabel = "MPG", geom_bar_control = list(width = 0.4))

title: Tornado and Importance Plots
code: torn3 <- tornado::tornado(lm1, type = "percentiles", alpha = 0.05) plot(torn3, xlabel = "MPG", geom_bar_control = list(width = 0.4))

title: Tornado and Importance Plots
code: lm4 <- lm(mpg ~ cyl + wt + hp + vs, data = mtcars_w_factors) torn4 <- tornado::tornado(lm4, type = "percentiles", alpha = 0.05) plot(torn4, xlabel = "MPG", geom_bar_control = list(width = 0.4))

title: Tornado and Importance Plots
code: dict <- list(old = c("cyl", "wt", "hp", "vs"),              new = c("Cylinders", "Weight", "Horsepower", "V_or_Straight")) torn5 <- tornado::tornado(lm4, type = "percentiles", alpha = 0.05, dict = dict) plot(torn5, xlabel = "MPG", geom_bar_control = list(width = 0.4))

title: Tornado and Importance Plots
code: dict <- list(old = c("cyl", "wt", "hp", "vs"),              new = c("Cylinders", "Weight", "Horsepower", "V_or_Straight")) torn5 <- tornado::tornado(lm4, type = "percentiles", alpha = 0.05) plot(torn5, xlabel = "MPG", geom_bar_control = list(width = 0.4),      sensitivity_colors = c("#FC8D62", "#66C2A5"),      geom_point_control = list(size = 3, fill = "purple", col = "purple"))

title: Tornado and Importance Plots
text: Notes: plot center 0 x-axis relabeled. Adding lines plot use zero centered coordinate system Also, plot drawn using coord_flip, horizonal line draw vertically
code: g <- plot(torn5, plot = FALSE, xlabel = "MPG", geom_bar_control = list(width = 0.4),           sensitivity_colors = c("#FC8D62", "#66C2A5"),           geom_point_control = list(size = 3, fill = "purple", col = "purple")) g <- g + ggtitle("Test Plot") g <- g + geom_hline(yintercept = 0, col = "black", lwd = 2) plot(g)

title: Tornado and Importance Plots
text: Predict engine V Straight given covariates
code: glm1 <- glm(vs ~ wt + disp + cyl, data = mtcars, family = binomial(link = "logit")) torn1 <- tornado::tornado(glm1, type = "ranges", alpha = 0.10) plot(torn1, xlabel = "V or Straight Engine", geom_bar_control = list(width = 0.4))

title: Tornado and Importance Plots
code: survreg1 <- survival::survreg(survival::Surv(futime, fustat) ~ ecog.ps + rx + age + resid.ds,                                survival::ovarian, dist = 'weibull', scale = 1) torn1 <- tornado::tornado(survreg1, modeldata = survival::ovarian,                            type = "PercentChange", alpha = 0.10) plot(torn1, xlabel = "Survival Time", geom_bar_control = list(width = 0.4))

title: Tornado and Importance Plots
code: coxph1 <- survival::coxph(survival::Surv(stop, event) ~ rx + size + number,                           survival::bladder) torn1 <- tornado::tornado(coxph1, modeldata = survival::bladder, type = "PercentChange",                           alpha = 0.10) plot(torn1, xlabel = "Risk", geom_bar_control = list(width = 0.4))

title: Tornado and Importance Plots
code: if (requireNamespace("glmnet", quietly = TRUE)) {   form <- formula(mpg ~ cyl*wt*hp)   mf <- model.frame(form, data=mtcars)   mm <- model.matrix(form, mf)   gtest <- glmnet::cv.glmnet(x = mm, y = mtcars$mpg, family = "gaussian")   torn <- tornado::tornado(gtest, modeldata = mtcars,                             form = formula(mpg ~ cyl*wt*hp),                             s = "lambda.1se",                            type = "PercentChange", alpha = 0.10)   plot(torn, xlabel = "MPG", geom_bar_control = list(width = 0.4)) } else {   print("glmnet is not available for vignette rendering") }

previous_headings: Tornado Plot Examples > Machine Learning Models
title: Tornado and Importance Plots
code: if (requireNamespace("caret", quietly = TRUE) &    requireNamespace("randomForest", quietly = TRUE)) {   gtest <- caret::train(x = subset(mtcars_w_factors, select = -mpg),                          y = mtcars_w_factors$mpg, method = "rf")   torn <- tornado::tornado(gtest, type = "percentiles", alpha = 0.10)   plot(torn, xlabel = "MPG") } else {   print("caret or randomForest is not available for vignette rendering") } #> Loading required package: lattice

previous_headings: Tornado Plot Examples > Machine Learning Models
title: Tornado and Importance Plots
text: plot method can also return ggplot object
code: if (requireNamespace("caret", quietly = TRUE) &    requireNamespace("randomForest", quietly = TRUE)) {   gtest <- caret::train(x = subset(iris, select = -Species),                          y = iris$Species, method = "rf")   torn <- tornado::tornado(gtest, type = "percentiles", alpha = 0.10, class_number = 1)   g <- plot(torn, plot = FALSE, xlabel = "Probability of the Setosa Species")   g <- g + ggtitle("Classifier caret::train 'rf', 10th to 90th perc. of each var.")   plot(g)    torn <- tornado::tornado(gtest, type = "percentiles", alpha = 0.10, class_number = 2)   g <- plot(torn, plot = FALSE, xlabel = "Probability of the versicolor Species")   plot(g) } else {   print("caret or randomForest is not available for vignette rendering") }

title: Tornado and Importance Plots
code: gtest <- lm(mpg ~ cyl*wt*hp + gear + carb, data = mtcars) gtestreduced <- lm(mpg ~ 1, data = mtcars) imp <- tornado::importance(gtest, gtestreduced) plot(imp)

what: Using a dictionary to translate the variable names and chaning colors
title: Tornado and Importance Plots
code: dict <- list(old = c("cyl", "wt", "hp", "vs", "gear", "carb"),              new = c("Cylinders", "Weight", "Horsepower", "V_or_Straight", "Num Gears", "Num Carbs")) imp <- tornado::importance(gtest, gtestreduced, dict = dict) plot(imp, col_importance_alone = "#8DD3C7",       col_importance_cumulative = "#FFFFB3")

title: Tornado and Importance Plots
code: gtest <- glm(vs ~ wt + disp + gear, data = mtcars, family = binomial(link = "logit")) gtestreduced <- glm(vs ~ 1, data = mtcars, family = binomial(link = "logit")) imp <- tornado::importance(gtest, gtestreduced) plot(imp)

title: Tornado and Importance Plots
code: model_final <- survival::survreg(survival::Surv(futime, fustat) ~ ecog.ps*rx + age,                                  data = survival::ovarian,                                  dist = "weibull") imp <- tornado::importance(model_final, survival::ovarian, nperm = 100) plot(imp, geom_bar_control = list(width = 0.4, fill = "blue"))

title: Tornado and Importance Plots
text: number variables plotted can also controlled
code: if (requireNamespace("caret", quietly = TRUE) &    requireNamespace("randomForest", quietly = TRUE)) {   gtest <- caret::train(x = subset(mtcars_w_factors, select = -mpg),                          y = mtcars_w_factors$mpg, method = "rf")   imp <- tornado::importance(gtest)   plot(imp, nvar = 7) } else {   print("caret or randomForest is not available for vignette rendering") }

title: Tornado and Importance Plots
text: plot method can also return ggplot object
code: if (requireNamespace("caret", quietly = TRUE) &    requireNamespace("randomForest", quietly = TRUE)) {   gtest <- caret::train(x = subset(iris, select = -Species),                          y = iris$Species, method = "rf")   imp <- tornado::importance(gtest)   g <- plot(imp, plot = FALSE)   g <- g + ggtitle("Classifier caret::train randomforest: variable importance")   plot(g) } else {   print("caret or randomForest is not available for vignette rendering") }

title: Authors and Citation
text: Rob Carnell. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Carnell R (2024). tornado: Plots Model Sensitivity Variable Importance. R package version 0.2.0, https://github.com/bertcarnell/tornado, https://bertcarnell.github.io/tornado/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {tornado: Plots for Model Sensitivity and Variable Importance},   author = {Rob Carnell},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.2.0, https://github.com/bertcarnell/tornado},   url = {https://bertcarnell.github.io/tornado/}, }

what: Plots for Model Sensitivity and Variable Importance
title: Plots for Model Sensitivity and Variable Importance
text: tornado plots model sensitivity analysis. website

title: Plots for Model Sensitivity and Variable Importance
text: can also install development version tornado github :
code: if (!require(devtools)) install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("bertcarnell/tornado")

title: Plots for Model Sensitivity and Variable Importance
code: lm1 <- lm(mpg ~ cyl*wt*hp, data = mtcars) torn1 <- tornado(lm1, type = "PercentChange", alpha = 0.10) plot(torn1, xlabel = "MPG", geom_bar_control = list(width = 0.5))

title: Plots for Model Sensitivity and Variable Importance
text: Plots can also created range input data  Plots can include factors percentiles data well.
code: glm2 <- glm(vs ~ wt + disp + cyl, data = mtcars, family = binomial(link = "logit")) torn2 <- tornado(glm2, type = "ranges", alpha = 0.10) plot(torn2, xlabel = "Probability of Straight Engine", geom_bar_control = list(width = 0.5)) mydata <- mtcars mydata$am <- factor(mtcars$am) mydata$vs <- factor(mtcars$vs) glm2 <- glm(mpg ~ wt + cyl + am + vs, data = mydata, family = gaussian) torn2 <- tornado(glm2, type = "percentiles", alpha = 0.10) plot(torn2, xlabel = "MPG",       geom_bar_control = list(width = 0.5),      sensitivity_colors = c("#E41A1C", "#377EB8"),      geom_point_control = list(fill = "red", col = "red", size = 3))

title: Plots for Model Sensitivity and Variable Importance
text: Accelerated Failure Model  Cox Proportional Hazard Model 2 Standard Deviation bars
code: survreg3 <- survival::survreg(survival::Surv(futime, fustat) ~ ecog.ps + rx + age + resid.ds,                                survival::ovarian, dist = 'weibull', scale = 1) torn3 <- tornado(survreg3, modeldata = survival::ovarian, type = "PercentChange", alpha = 0.10) plot(torn3, xlabel = "Survival Time", geom_bar_control = list(width = 0.5)) coxph4 <- survival::coxph(survival::Surv(stop, event) ~ rx + size + number,                           survival::bladder) torn4 <- tornado(coxph4, modeldata = survival::bladder, type = "StdDev",                  alpha = 2) plot(torn4, xlabel = "Risk", geom_bar_control = list(width = 0.5))

title: Plots for Model Sensitivity and Variable Importance
text: plot method can also return ggplot object
code: mydat <- mtcars mydat$am <- factor(mydat$am, labels = c("A", "M")) mydat$vs <- factor(mydat$vs, labels = c("V", "S")) mydat$cyl <- factor(mydat$cyl) mydat$gear <- factor(mydat$gear) mydat$carb <- factor(mydat$carb)  gtest <- caret::train(x = subset(mydat, select = -vs), y = mydat$vs, method = "rf") torn <- tornado(gtest, type = "percentiles", alpha = 0.10, class_number = 1) g <- plot(torn, plot = FALSE, xlabel = "Probability of Class V-shaped Engine", geom_bar_control = list(width = 0.5)) g <- g + ggtitle("Classifier caret::train randomforest, 90-110% of the mean in each variable") plot(g)

title: Plot Variable Importance for a GLMNET model — importance.cv.glmnet
code: if (requireNamespace("glmnet", quietly = TRUE)) {   form <- formula(mpg ~ cyl*wt*hp)   mf <- model.frame(form, data = mtcars)   mm <- model.matrix(mf, mf)   gtest <- glmnet::cv.glmnet(x = mm, y = mtcars$mpg, family = "gaussian")   imp <- importance(gtest, mtcars, form, nperm = 50)   plot(imp) }

title: Plot an Importance Plot object — plot.importance_plot
text: x importance_plot object plot boolean determine plot displayed, just returned nvar number variables plot order importance col_imp_alone color used variance explained variable alone col_imp_cumulative color used cumulative variance explained geom_bar_control list arguments control plotting ggplot2::geom_bar ... future arguments

title: print data in an importance_plot — print.importance_plot
code: gtest <- glm(vs ~ wt + disp + gear, data=mtcars, family=binomial(link="logit")) gtestreduced <- glm(vs ~ 1, data=mtcars, family=binomial(link="logit")) g <- importance(gtest, gtestreduced) print(g) #> Importance Plot using model of type glm  #>   variable posit      value #> 1       wt Alone 0.00000000 #> 2     disp Alone 0.39833006 #> 3     gear Alone 0.04353826 #> 4       wt Space 0.00000000 #> 5     disp Space 0.00000000 #> 6     gear Space 0.67255183 #> 7       wt   Cum 0.39833006 #> 8     disp   Cum 0.31776003 #> 9     gear   Cum 0.28390991

what: Cox Proportional Hazards Tornado Diagram — tornado.coxph
title: Cox Proportional Hazards Tornado Diagram — tornado.coxph
text: tornado plot visualization range outputs expected variety inputs, alternatively, sensitivity output range inputs.  center tornado plotted response expected mean input variable.  given variable, width tornado determined range variable, multiplicative factor variable, quantile variable.  Variables ordered vertically widest bar top narrowest bottom.  one variable moved mean value time.  Factors categorical variables also added plots plotting dots resulting output factor varied levels.  base factor level chosen input variable center tornado.

title: Cox Proportional Hazards Tornado Diagram — tornado.coxph
code: # S3 method for class 'coxph' tornado(model, type = "PercentChange", alpha = 0.1, dict = NA, modeldata, ...)

title: Cox Proportional Hazards Tornado Diagram — tornado.coxph
text: model model object type PercentChange, percentiles, ranges, StdDev alpha level change, percentile level, number standard deviations dict dictionary translate variables plot.  dictionary must list data.frame elements old new.  old element must contain variable model. modeldata data used fit model ... arguments, used

title: Cox Proportional Hazards Tornado Diagram — tornado.coxph
text: tornado_plot object type type tornado plot data data required plot family model family available

title: Cox Proportional Hazards Tornado Diagram — tornado.coxph
code: gtest <- survival::coxph(survival::Surv(stop, event) ~ rx + size + number,                            survival::bladder) torn <- tornado(gtest, modeldata = survival::bladder, type = "PercentChange",              alpha = 0.10) plot(torn, xlabel = "Risk")

title: GLMNET Tornado Diagram — tornado.cv.glmnet
text: tornado plot visualization range outputs expected variety inputs, alternatively, sensitivity output range inputs.  center tornado plotted response expected mean input variable.  given variable, width tornado determined range variable, multiplicative factor variable, quantile variable.  Variables ordered vertically widest bar top narrowest bottom.  one variable moved mean value time.  Factors categorical variables also added plots plotting dots resulting output factor varied levels.  base factor level chosen input variable center tornado.

title: GLMNET Tornado Diagram — tornado.cv.glmnet
code: # S3 method for class 'cv.glmnet' tornado(   model,   type = "PercentChange",   alpha = 0.1,   dict = NA,   modeldata,   form,   s = "lambda.1se",   ... )

title: GLMNET Tornado Diagram — tornado.cv.glmnet
text: model model object type PercentChange, percentiles, ranges, StdDev alpha level change, percentile level, number standard deviations dict dictionary translate variables plot.  dictionary must list data.frame elements old new.  old element must contain variable model. modeldata raw data used fit glmnet model form model formula s Value(s) penalty parameter lambda predictions required. Default value s="lambda.1se" stored CV object. Alternatively s="lambda.min" can used. s numeric, taken value(s) lambda used. ... arguments, used

title: GLMNET Tornado Diagram — tornado.cv.glmnet
text: tornado_plot object type type tornado plot data data required plot family model family available

title: GLMNET Tornado Diagram — tornado.cv.glmnet
code: if (requireNamespace("glmnet", quietly = TRUE)) {   form <- formula(mpg ~ cyl*wt*hp)   mf <- model.frame(form, data = mtcars)   mm <- model.matrix(form, data = mf)   gtest <- glmnet::cv.glmnet(x = mm, y= mtcars$mpg, family = "gaussian")   torn <- tornado(gtest, modeldata = mtcars, form = formula(mpg ~ cyl*wt*hp), s = "lambda.1se",                   type = "PercentChange", alpha = 0.10)   plot(torn, xlabel = "MPG") }

title: GLM Tornado Diagram — tornado.glm
text: tornado plot visualization range outputs expected variety inputs, alternatively, sensitivity output range inputs.  center tornado plotted response expected mean input variable.  given variable, width tornado determined range variable, multiplicative factor variable, quantile variable.  Variables ordered vertically widest bar top narrowest bottom.  one variable moved mean value time.  Factors categorical variables also added plots plotting dots resulting output factor varied levels.  base factor level chosen input variable center tornado.

title: Survreg Tornado Diagram — tornado.survreg
code: gtest <- survival::survreg(survival::Surv(futime, fustat) ~ ecog.ps + rx,                            survival::ovarian,                            dist='weibull', scale=1) torn <- tornado(gtest, modeldata = survival::ovarian, type = "PercentChange",              alpha = 0.10, xlabel = "futime") plot(torn, xlabel = "Survival Time")

title: Caret Tornado Diagram — tornado.train
code: if (requireNamespace("caret", quietly = TRUE) &     requireNamespace("randomForest", quietly = TRUE)) {   gtest <- caret::train(x = subset(mtcars, select = -mpg), y = mtcars$mpg, method = "rf")   torn <- tornado(gtest, type = "PercentChange", alpha = 0.10)   plot(torn, xlabel = "MPG") }

title: version 0.2.0 (2024-07-30)
text: bug report @ghobro (https://github.com/ghobro) weighted models improved x-axis scales

title: version 0.1.4 (2024-01-18)
text: Update package website. Thanks @olivroy pull request.

text: CRAN release: 2024-01-21 Updates work ggplot2 3.5.0 (#8) Thanks @teunbrand pull request. Added plots display sensitivity standard deviations
